subject: Politics
title: The Power of Ideas
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Power of Ideas.

hook.text: The Enlightenment gave people new ideas: liberty, equality, rights. Then they demanded their rulers deliver them.

buildup.text: Revolutions need ideology. People must believe a better system is possible before they risk everything.

discovery.text: Locke's ideas inspired America's founders. Marx's ideas inspired communist revolutions across the globe.

twist.text: Ideas spread faster than armies. A pamphlet in 1776 and a tweet in 2011 both ignited revolutions.

climax.text: Authoritarian regimes fear ideas more than weapons. Censorship is always the first line of defense.

punchline.text: Ideas arm revolutions. Bullets enforce them, but ideas start them.

quiz.question: Why do authoritarian regimes prioritize censorship?
options: Ideas that challenge the system are more dangerous than physical threats
Censorship has no practical political purpose
Free speech always strengthens authoritarian rule
